paper_metadata.title: Impact of a Multifaceted Program on Child Development in Burkina Faso

program_information.target_population: Ultra-poor households with young children or pregnant women

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: The design includes a cash transfer program (T1), T1 plus animal transfer (T2) and T2 plus a nutrition bundle

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: The design includes a cash transfer program (T1), T1 plus animal transfer (T2) and T2 plus a nutrition bundle which includes fortified flour, a gardening kit and nutrition education (T3)

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: We find that the program reduces extreme poverty in all treatment branches, but only T3 positively impacts child nutrition. T3 also impacts motor and cognitive development of new born children.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: We employ the False Discovery Rate (FDR) to control for multiple hypothesis testing when analyzing indices

bonus_information.cost_mentions: nutrition interventions valued at $24 per household
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: the relative cost effectiveness of nutrition interventions (in our case valued by the household head at $24 per household)

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: We study the impacts of a multifaceted program implemented in Burkina Faso that targets ultra-poor households with young children or pregnant women
evidence_citations.country_citation: We study the impacts of a multifaceted program implemented in Burkina Faso
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: targets ultra-poor households with young children or pregnant women
